    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.app.Instrumentation instrumentation,
                        android.os.Bundle arguments)
        Initializes this class. If you use a runner that is not DroidDriver-aware, you need to call this method appropriately. See TestRunner.onCreate(android.os.Bundle) for example.

      • getInstrumentation

        public static android.app.Instrumentation getInstrumentation()

      • getTargetContext

        public static android.content.Context getTargetContext()

      • getOptions

        public static android.os.Bundle getOptions()
        Gets the am instrument options.

      • getOption

        public static java.lang.String getOption(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the string value associated with the given key. This is preferred over using getOptions() because the returned Bundle contains only string values - am instrument options do not support value types other than string.

      • getD2Option

        public static java.lang.String getD2Option(java.lang.String key)
        Calls getOption(java.lang.String) with "dd." prefixed to key. This is for DroidDriver implementation to use a consistent pattern for its options.

      • tryWaitForIdleSync

        public static boolean tryWaitForIdleSync(long timeoutMillis)
        Tries to wait for an idle state on the main thread on best-effort basis up to timeoutMillis. The main thread may not enter the idle state when animation is playing, for example, the ProgressBar.

      • runOnMainSyncWithTimeout

        public static void runOnMainSyncWithTimeout(java.lang.Runnable runnable)

      • runOnMainSyncWithTimeout

        public static <V> V runOnMainSyncWithTimeout(java.util.concurrent.Callable<V> callable)
        Runs callable on the main thread on best-effort basis up to a time limit, which defaults to 10000L and can be set as an am instrument option under the key dd.runOnMainSyncTimeout.

        This is a safer variation of Instrumentation.runOnMainSync(java.lang.Runnable) because the latter may hang. You may turn off this behavior by setting "-e dd.runOnMainSyncTimeout 0" on the am command line.

        The callable may never run, for example, if the main Looper has exited due to uncaught exception.
